comment.body:
Ok so you have marked this as completed, as a fellow software professional I ask you what is your solution as I don’t see any difference 
Looking thru the log I see mention of android and not having an iPhone or iOS device to test
If you market your product as suitable for a particular OS then you should have devices to sandbox testing any proposed solutions 
Closing it as completed is not a satisfactory solution without an explanation so far I have seen a smiley face and a closure
Not ideal

comment.body:
@Alex-302 I have been able to reproduce this. Mapbox caches aggressively, so if you test AdGuard off first, the map tiles will be cached, thus making it not reproducible. 

This is related to #98853.

Mapbox allows web developers to limit api keys to a particular referrer: https://docs.mapbox.com/accounts/guides/tokens/#url-restrictions

The url being blocked in this case does not include the "secure" text in the URL which was included in the fix for #98853.

Recommend updating the filter at https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/5ff2ace28bd0af68584d482eba7cfae1b1be2709/BaseFilter/sections/allowlist_stealth.txt#L1118 to:

```
@@||api.mapbox.com/*?*&access_token=$stealth=referrer
```

This makes it a bit more open to mapbox api requests that need the referrer, while making the stealth mode more specific to just the referrer that is needed.

This also likely eliminates the need for domain specific mapbox stealth disables that are found in https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/BaseFilter/sections/allowlist_stealth.txt
